intro: Oxydectes medusae, commonly known as the sea hare, is a marine gastropod mollusk belonging to the family Aplysiidae. It is characterized by its soft, gelatinous body and a distinctive, often colorful mantle that can resemble a sea slug. The species is found in tropical and temperate waters worldwide, typically in shallow coastal areas. Oxydectes medusae has a unique ability to secrete a variety of alkaloids, some of which have potential pharmaceutical applications. Its reproductive system is complex, with separate sexes and a direct development process that involves laying eggs in gelatinous masses.
